Package game

Class EnemyCollision

java.lang.Object
game.EnemyCollision
All Implemented Interfaces:
city.cs.engine.CollisionListener, EventListener
public class EnemyCollision extends Object implements city.cs.engine.CollisionListener
Handles collision events between a player and enemies in the game.

This class implements CollisionListener to define the behavior when a player collides with an enemy. Depending on the player's armour status, the collision either decreases the player's armour or health. This ensures that armour provides a protective mechanism before health is impacted, reflecting typical gameplay mechanics where armour shields players from immediate health loss.

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • EnemyCollision

      public EnemyCollision(Player player)
      Constructs an EnemyCollision listener associated with a specific player.

      This constructor initializes the collision handler with a reference to the player, allowing it to modify the player's health or armour during collision events with enemies.

      Parameters:
      player - The player involved in collisions with enemies.

  • Method Details

    • collide

      public void collide(city.cs.engine.CollisionEvent e)
      Responds to collision events where the colliding body is an enemy.

      This method checks if the colliding body is an enemy. If it is, it then checks the player's armour status. If the player has armour (i.e., armour value is 1), the armour is decreased. If no armour is present, the player's health is decreased. This mechanism prioritizes armour depletion before affecting health, adding a layer of strategy and protection for the player.

      Specified by:
      collide in interface city.cs.engine.CollisionListener
      Parameters:
      e - The event details of the collision.
